statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ 3 \\ -1 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ 1 \\ -5 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -21 \\ -13 \\ 23 \\ -14 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 21 \\ 13 \\ -23 \\ 14 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ -5 \\ 0 \\ -4 \end{array}\right] span or don't span \mathbb{R}^4.

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ 3 \\ -1 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ 1 \\ -5 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -21 \\ -13 \\ 23 \\ -14 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 21 \\ 13 \\ -23 \\ 14 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ -5 \\ 0 \\ -4 \end{array}\right] do not span \mathbb{R}^4.
